data.title: Penalty Shootout
data.statement:
You must determine the winner and the score of a football/soccer penalty shootout, based on the penalties taken.
There is no draw in a penalty shootout. 
Each team takes turns shooting, the first shooter is part of team 1, and the second is part of team 2, and so on.
For each penalty you will know the direction of the shot and the direction of the goalkeeper's dive.
The shooter scores a point if he does not shoot from the same side as the goalkeeper's dive.
If he shoots from the same side or does not hit the target (miss) he does not score any point for his team.

Exemple:
Left Right -> Goal
Right Right -> No Goal
Miss Center -> No Goal

testCases.testIn:
8
Left Center
Left Right
Left Left
Center Right
Miss Left
Left Center
Center Left
Left Right

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read penalty:word(10) goalkeeper:word(10)
write 2 2-4
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1 :>> an integer [[N]], the number of penalties taken in the whole shootout. 
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A string [[penalty]] for the direction of the shot ({{Left}}, {{Center}}, {{Right}}, or {{Miss}}), followed by a space, and then a string [[goalkeeper]] for the direction of the goalkeeper's dive ({{Left}}, {{Center}}, or {{Right}})
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1>>: The result of the penalty shootout in the following format:
[[win_team]] [[score1]]{{-}}[[score2]]
Where 
[[win_team]] is the winning team number,
[[score1]] is the score of team 1,
[[score2]] is the score of team 2.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You must determine the winner and the score of a football/soccer penalty shootout, based on the penalties taken.
There is no draw in a penalty shootout.
Each team takes turns shooting, the first shooter is part of team 1, and the second is part of team 2, and so on.
For each penalty you will know the direction of the shot and the direction of the goalkeeper's dive.
The shooter scores a point if he does not shoot from the same side as the goalkeeper's dive.
If he shoots from the same side or does not hit the target (miss) he does not score any point for his team.

Exemple:
Left Right -> Goal
Right Right -> No Goal
Miss Center -> No Goal
Input
Line 1 : an integer N, the number of penalties taken in the whole shootout.
Next N lines: A string penalty for the direction of the shot (Left, Center, Right, or Miss), followed by a space, and then a string goalkeeper for the direction of the goalkeeper's dive (Left, Center, or Right)
Output
Line 1: The result of the penalty shootout in the following format:
win_team score1-score2
Where
win_team is the winning team number,
score1 is the score of team 1,
score2 is the score of team 2.
Constraints
Example
Input
8
Left Center
Left Right
Left Left
Center Right
Miss Left
Left Center
Center Left
Left Right
Output
2 2-4
